intro: Zanthoxylum tsihanimposa, commonly known as the Tsihanimposa prickly ash, is a member of the Rutaceae family and is native to specific regions in Africa. It is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, red berries that are typically consumed by birds and other wildlife. Zanthoxylum tsihanimposa is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions. Its bark and leaves contain bioactive compounds that have been studied for potential medicinal properties.
